lines.text: When caught between two evils, I generally like to take the one I never tried.

[singing]
I'm an Occidental woman in an Oriental mood for love...
We've never had a woman passenger on this boat. That is, none like you!

Now I'll tell ya - you people have been on the wrong track, and I'm gonna steer you right You'll never get anywhere because you don't know how to wrassle the devil. Tying a knot in his tail won't throw 'im on his back; you've gotta grab 'im by his horns - you've gotta know him, know his tricks. I know 'em, and how I know 'em! Why, I can make him say uncle - that is, if he's got an uncle.
I got a debt to pay - not to this crowd, but to Annie, and I'm gonna do it. It won't take long, and then I'll be squared up.
I can always tell a lady.
Bull, you ain't no oil paintin', but you're a fascinatin' monster.
